            </gmd:citation>
            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>The New Brunswick Department of Environment and Local Government’s Surface Water Monitoring Network (SWMN) provides information on the quality of the New Brunswick’s major river systems. The SWMN program was fully established in 2003 and is currently composed of 55 monitoring stations that are sampled several times throughout the year. Station locations were selected to provide proper geographical coverage of the province’s major river systems. The goals of the SWMN program include:
•	to monitor, assess and report on the ambient water quality of major rivers and tributaries in the Province of New Brunswick, 
•	to ensure that high quality data is available to support DELG’s programs for planning and approvals; contribute to cumulative effects assessments; aid in public reporting and meet requirements of our partners.
•	to conduct assessments and reporting on our surface waters and to raise awareness of the state of the environment in New Brunswick.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

keywords_translation_method.fr: Keyword text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

name: 10-25976-h483-jc56
notes:
The New Brunswick Department of Environment and Local Government’s Surface Water Monitoring Network (SWMN) provides information on the quality of the New Brunswick’s major river systems. The SWMN program was fully established in 2003 and is currently composed of 55 monitoring stations that are sampled several times throughout the year. Station locations were selected to provide proper geographical coverage of the province’s major river systems. The goals of the SWMN program include:
•	to monitor, assess and report on the ambient water quality of major rivers and tributaries in the Province of New Brunswick, 
•	to ensure that high quality data is available to support DELG’s programs for planning and approvals; contribute to cumulative effects assessments; aid in public reporting and meet requirements of our partners.
•	to conduct assessments and reporting on our surface waters and to raise awareness of the state of the environment in New Brunswick.

notes_translated.en:
The New Brunswick Department of Environment and Local Government’s Surface Water Monitoring Network (SWMN) provides information on the quality of the New Brunswick’s major river systems. The SWMN program was fully established in 2003 and is currently composed of 55 monitoring stations that are sampled several times throughout the year. Station locations were selected to provide proper geographical coverage of the province’s major river systems. The goals of the SWMN program include:
•	to monitor, assess and report on the ambient water quality of major rivers and tributaries in the Province of New Brunswick, 
•	to ensure that high quality data is available to support DELG’s programs for planning and approvals; contribute to cumulative effects assessments; aid in public reporting and meet requirements of our partners.
•	to conduct assessments and reporting on our surface waters and to raise awareness of the state of the environment in New Brunswick.
notes_translated.fr:
Le Réseau de surveillance des eaux de surface (SWMN) du ministère de l'Environnement et des Gouvernements locaux du Nouveau-Brunswick fournit des informations sur la qualité des principaux réseaux fluviaux du Nouveau-Brunswick. Le programme SWMN a été entièrement mis en place en 2003 et comprend actuellement 55 stations de surveillance qui sont échantillonnées plusieurs fois au cours de l'année. L'emplacement des stations a été choisi pour assurer une couverture géographique adéquate des principaux réseaux fluviaux de la province. Les objectifs du programme SWMN sont les suivants :
• surveiller, évaluer et rendre compte de la qualité de l'eau ambiante des principaux cours d'eau et affluents de la province du Nouveau-Brunswick, 
• garantir la disponibilité de données de haute qualité pour soutenir les programmes de planification et d'approbation du DELG ; contribuer aux évaluations des effets cumulatifs ; faciliter la rédaction de rapports publics et répondre aux exigences de nos partenaires.
• pour effectuer des évaluations et des rapports sur nos eaux de surface et pour sensibiliser le public à l'état de l'environnement au Nouveau-Brunswick.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: New Brunswick Surface Water Monitoring Network

title_translated.fr: Réseau de surveillance des eaux de surface du Nouveau-Brunswick
